text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
Minor editorial changes have been made throughout the text.
IRM 5.7.10.2.2 provides guidance for CPM actions when there is no ATFR case in pending inventory but a case ﬁle has been received.
IRM 5.7.10.2.3 provides guidance for CPM actions when ATFR case is in pending inventory and a case ﬁle has been received.
5.7.10.2.3(6) provides guidance for CPM actions when it is appropriate to issue a Form 5942 return a TFRP case to the originator.
IRM 5.7.10.3 provides guidance for CPM actions upon receipt of a quick, prompt or jeopardy assessment processed by a revenue officer, including necessary documents or return to officer.

IRM 5.7.10.5(1) note provides reminder that per IRM 5.7.6.1.9, Transmittal of Case to Appeals, Field Collection is responsible for ensuring all necessary documents are included in the TFRP case ﬁle and for the accuracy of the protests timeliness determination.
IRM 5.7.10.7 provides guidance for CPM inventory management and for Advisory CPM management to review ATFR inventories and reports monthly to identify cases requiring attention.
IRM 5.7.10-1 Exhibit is removed as CPM is not required to complete a check
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

This material supersedes IRM 5.7.10, dated May 15, 2015. This IRM revision incorporates Collection Interim Guidance Memorandum SBSE-05-0716-0032, Trust Fund Recovery Penalty (TFRP) Case Processing, dated July 01, 2016.
AUDIENCE

Chapter Overview Automated Trust Fund Recovery CPM Employee Control Structure Case Processing ATFR Case in Pending Inventory - No Case File Received ATFR Case Not in Pending Inventory - Case File Received ATFR Case in Pending Inventory - Case File Received Processing Quick, Prompt and Jeopardy Assessments Received Monitoring of
to Campus Inventory Appeals Case Processing Appeals Cases - Controlling and Monitoring ATFR Inventory Management and Reports Case Retention and Retirement Requests for Closed TFRP Files
Point Monitoring (CPM) Trust Fund Recovery (TFRP) Case Processing 5.7.10 page 1
This chapter provides guidance to Advisory Control Point Monitoring (CPM) on the processing of Trust Fund Recovery Penalty (TFRP) ﬁles.

The Automated Trust Fund Recovery (ATFR) program is a National Standard Application used to control TFRP case inventories. Control Point Monitoring (CPM) is one of three components of the ATFR program. The CPM component of the program, located in Advisory, is responsible for ensuring that TFRP case ﬁles are submitted by Field Collection (FC) and the ﬁnal disposition of the case has been accurately recorded on the ATFR system.

Application used to control TFRP case inventories. Control Point Monitoring (CPM) is one of three components of the ATFR program. The CPM of the program, located in Advisory, is responsible for ensuring that TFRP ﬁles are submitted by Field Collection (FC) and the ﬁnal disposition of the has been accurately recorded on the ATFR system. The ATFR CPM Inventory consists of four separate inventories: • “Pending” - Cases transmitted to CPM which are awaiting receipt of TFRP case ﬁles. • “Accepted” – Case ﬁle has been received . • “
to SC” – Case ﬁle has been transmitted to the campus for sessment. • “Appeals” – Case ﬁle has been forwarded to Appeals. (
) CPM has the ability to record the following information on ATFR: • Processing dates for Form
, Request for Trust Fund Recovery Penalty Assessment(s) • Appeals case information • Date TFRP ﬁle is sent to Federal Records Center (FRC) • TFRP assessment information • Closed TFRP ﬁle requests (

) CPM must maintain an accurate ATFR employee control structure. The employee control structure should contain all of the groups/territories by a CPM so cases appear correctly on ATFR inventory screens and CPM users should use ATFR “Resync” on a regular basis to account for changes to the TSIGNs within their assigned range. (
) Cases received from ROs within a CPM’s assigned work structure should processed by CPM regardless of the address of the business entity. (
) Cases are systemically added to the CPM inventory after the revenue (RO) selects “
to CPM” to submit the responsible person’s TFRP ﬁle. (
) ROs will mail the TFRP case ﬁle to CPM after updating ATFR “

The ATFR CPM Inventory consists of four separate inventories:
“Pending” - Cases transmitted to CPM which are awaiting receipt of TFRP case ﬁles. “Accepted” – Case ﬁle has been received . “
to SC” – Case ﬁle has been transmitted to the campus for as- sessment. “Appeals” – Case ﬁle has been forwarded to Appeals.

business days for receipt of the ﬁle. If the ﬁle is not received within this time frame: a. Select the “Return to RO” option and select “TFRP Case File not after RO Notiﬁcation” on the systemic Form

to CPM” date was entered on ATFR using the “Find” - option from the ATFR-AO menu to locate the case. If date is not input the current date in the “
to CPM” ﬁeld on ATFR. b. If responsible party is still not on “Pending” Inventory, determine if the TSIGN is within your assigned TSIGN range. c. If RO is within your assigned TSIGN range, follow IRM

to update your control structure. d. If RO TSIGN is not within your assigned TSIGN range, contact the responsible for the TSIGN range to ensure that the RO is reﬂected in “Employee Control Structure”. Immediately forward the ﬁle to the CPM location working that TSIGN range on a Form
-A, Document mittal for Trust Fund Recovery Penalty Case Files. See IRM Shipping Personally Identiﬁable Information (PII). Potential ASED cases should be forwarded electronically (email or fax). (
) Within ﬁve business days of receipt of the physical TFRP ﬁle, CPM will: • Acknowledge Form
-A • Review the ATFR CPM “Pending” inventory and accept the case into File CPM “Accepted” inventory. (

) CPM will receive TFRP ﬁles in three categories: • TFRP assessment made by RO via the quick (Q), prompt (P), or jeopardy (J) assessment process • Regular TFRP assessment to be processed to the campus • TFRP protests to be processed to Appeals (

The systemic transmission of Form 2749 to the campus for assessment creates the ATFR “2749 to SC” inventory. This inventory will be reviewed
Any case remaining in this inventory for more than 21 calendar days requires IDRS research or contact with the campus for resolution. Exception: manual assessments may take up to 8 cycles to post.

Verify the posting of the TC 240 DLN, 23C date, assessed balance and TC 971 AC 097 by checking IDRS. After veriﬁcation, close the case on ATFR within 10 calendar days using the “Close 2749” option on the ATFR case.
Notate the front of case ﬁle folders with the date of assessment. This will identify the ﬁle for future retirement to the FRC.

(b). An Appeals hearing officer may determine that new mation submitted by a potentially responsible party requires investigative analysis. In this situation, Appeals will retain jurisdiction of the case and forward the new information request via Form

, Appeals Division Feedback Report and Transmittal Memorandum, to the originating CPM for processing. The CPM should consult with an advisor and if it is determined additional investigative analysis by a revenue officer is necessary, will follow guidance in IRM
, Types of Mandatory OIs, to issue an OI to FC. information should be provided within

calendar days of the request. This date may be extended by mutual agreement. These situations should be highly uncommon. To avoid ex parte communications, Appeals has the re- sponsibility for informing the potentially responsible party that the information was sent to FC for investigation, sharing FC’s response with the potentially responsible party and allowing the potentially responsible party time to comment. (
) When a ﬁnal determination is rendered, Appeals will return the case to CPM with Form
, Appeals Transmittal and Case Memo, which will reﬂect the Appeals decision. CPM will update the ATFR system with the: • Form

While the ASED was extended by TBOR-
for the time the case was pending in Appeals and under their jurisdiction, it is only protected for an additional
calendar days from the date of the ﬁnal Appeals determination as indicated by the managerial signature on the Form
, Appeals Transmittal and Case Memo, Form
, Agreement as to Final Determination of Tax Liability, or Form
, Closing Agreement on Final Determination Covering Speciﬁc Matters. The following steps will be taken to ensure the assessment is
Update ATFR to the correct type of assessment to be completed (Quick, Prompt, Regular). Generate and print a new Form
for the case ﬁle to use when making a quick assessment under TBOR-
if the dollar amounts on the trust fund assertion have changed. Generate and print the Form
quick assessment documents from the ATFR system. Complete all required information on the Form
, including the request- or’s full address, phone number, and employee ICS assignment number. Prepare Form

with the taxpayer’s name, last four digits of the social security number and each period to be assessed listed. Include CPM re- questor’s fax number. (This page will be faxed back to CPM with the assessment date and the DLN for each period assessed.) Prepare a fax cover sheet with the taxpayer’s name and last four digits of the social security number and fax it to the Ogden Manual Assessment Unit with the following documents: Form
complete with all information Form
One copy of Form
for each period to be assessed, with the group manager’s signature.

The Ogden Manual Assessment Unit will fax back Form 3210 with the assessment date and DLN for each period. Upon receipt of this information, update ATFR with the DLN and assessment date and transmit the “2749 to SC”. (Inputting this date automatically moves the case from the Appeals inventory to the “2749 to SC” inventory). Follow the “2749 to SC” monitoring procedures as outlined in IRM 5.7.10.5.

For fax assessments, the Ogden Manual Assessment Unit will prepare Form 3552, Prompt Assessment Billing Assembly, and forward it to the initiator. The initiator will immediately deliver or mail certiﬁed Parts 3 and 4 of Form 3552, along with Publica-

For fax assessments, the Ogden Manual Assessment Unit will prepare Form 3552, Prompt Assessment Billing Assembly, and forward it to the initiator. The initiator immediately deliver or mail certiﬁed Parts 3 and 4 of Form 3552, along with tion 1, to the taxpayer. Notice 960, Explanation of Penalty Assessment on Form 3552 (Part 3), Notice of Tax Due on Federal Tax Return, will also be included with Form 3552 to remind the taxpayer of the procedures to follow in order to ﬁle a for refund and request abatement of the liability. Multiple Forms 3552 for the same taxpayer may be mailed together. Accounting Control/Services will also forward copies of the Forms 2749 and 3552 to the TFRP unit in Compliance Services Col- lection Operations (CSCO) for input of the appropriate cross-referencing and UNLCER information.
Point Monitoring (CPM) Trust Fund Recovery (TFRP) Case Processing 5.7.10 page 7

) The accuracy of the ATFR inventory is dependent upon maintaining an accurate employee control structure. Advisory CPM management should establish an employee control structure that mirrors the control structure of all their CPM employees. The most effective manner of inventory assignment is assign speciﬁc TSIGN ranges to a speciﬁc CPM employee. This will allow CPM users to view their own assigned inventory using the “My Inventory” option on ATFR. (
) ATFR provides the following inventory screens and reports: a. Pending-Displays responsible parties updated to Form “
to CPM” by RO. - Cases in this inventory longer than

days may require managerial in- tervention. b. Accepted-Displays responsible parties for which a physical ﬁle was received. - Displays responsible parties rejected by campus with an “R” indicator - Cases should not remain in this inventory. If not transmitted to campus Appeals upon receipt, cases should be rejected to RO. c. Appeals-Displays responsible parties updated from Accepted inventory to d.
to SC - Displays responsible parties updated to the campus for assessment ATFR inventory screens can be sorted by each column on the screen. Sorting inventory screens by “
to CPM”, “To Appeals”, or “
to SC” dates will allow for immediate identiﬁcation of older cases requiring attention. Sorting inventory screens by ASED date allows for immediate identiﬁcation of ASED issues. (
) Quarterly reconciliations will be conducted to reconcile the “Appeals” inventory with the Appeals Centralized Database System (ACDS) to ensure that cases are still open in Appeals. (
) Advisory CPM management should review ATFR inventories/reports monthly identify any aging cases requiring attention. (
) TFRP case ﬁles are retained in CPM until retirement to FRC (See IRM Exhibit
, Records Control Schedule for Collection, for TFRP records information.). The FRC requirement to retire the TFRP ﬁle, forms and documents
years after assessment, should be interpreted as
years from the latest assessment date of all responsible parties. This will insure that all ﬁles related to a speciﬁc TFRP are associated and retained for
years from assessment at the FRC. (
) When cases are to be retired to the FRC, Advisory CPM employees will add the accession number and FRC location in the designated ﬁeld on ATFR. (

) FRC guidelines require the electronic media be removed prior to shipment to FRC. All electronic media should be placed in the last box of the shipment. It the ROs responsibility to properly label electronic media.

5.7.10.8 (07-03-2017) Case Retention and Retirement
) CPM may receive requests for closed TFRP ﬁles from various requesters (Taxpayer Advocate Service, Appeals, Disclosure, etc.) via Form
If the Closed case ﬁle is in CPM’s closed TFRP ﬁle (assessment date within two years): a. Pull ﬁle and replace with a ﬁle charge-out card and send the entire case the requester via Form
b. Open an ICS

module when the case is returned to CPM and return to ﬁles. (
